title: Oracle Database Audit
descriptionMarkdown: The Oracle DB Audit data connector provides the capability to ingest [Oracle Database](https://www.oracle.com/database/technologies/) audit events into Azure Sentinel through the syslog. Refer to [documentation](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/dbseg/introduction-to-auditing.html#GUID-94381464-53A3-421B-8F13-BD171C867405) for more information.
additionalRequirementBanner: This data connector depends on a parser based on Kusto Function to work as expected. Follow the steps to use this Kusto Function alias **OracleDatabaseAuditEvent** in queries and workbooks. [Follow steps to get this Kusto Function>](https://aka.ms/sentinel-OracleDatabaseAudit-parser)

sampleQueries.query:
OracleDatabaseAuditEvent
 | summarize count() by SrcDvcHostname
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: Syslog (OracleDatabaseAudit)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
OracleDatabaseAuditEvent
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
OracleDatabaseAuditEvent
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. [Follow these steps](https://aka.ms/sentinel-OracleDatabaseAudit-parser) to create the Kusto Functions alias, **OracleDatabaseAuditEvent**

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux
instructionSteps.description:
Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.

1.  Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
2.  Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
3.  Click **Save**.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure Oracle Database Audit events to be sent to Syslog
instructionSteps.description:
[Follow these instructions](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/dbseg/administering-the-audit-trail.html#GUID-662AA54B-D878-4B78-94D3-733256B3F37C) to configure Oracle Database Audit events to be sent to Syslog.
For more information please refer to [documentation](https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/dbseg/administering-the-audit-trail.html)
